item.title: Noise-Robust Abstractive Compression in Retrieval-Augmented Language Models
item.description: arXiv:2512.08943v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Abstractive compression utilizes smaller langauge models to condense query-relevant context, reducing computational costs in retrieval-augmented generation (RAG). item.title: Luxical: High-Speed Lexical-Dense Text Embeddings
item.description: arXiv:2512.09015v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Frontier language model quality increasingly hinges on our ability to organize web-scale text corpora for training. item.title: Knowledge-Guided Large Language Model for Automatic Pediatric Dental Record Understanding and Safe Antibiotic Recommendation
item.description: arXiv:2512.09127v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Accurate interpretation of pediatric dental clinical records and safe antibiotic prescribing remain persistent challenges in dental informatics. item.description: arXiv:2512.09148v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Graph-based Retrieval-Augmented Generation (GraphRAG) enhances Large Language Models (LLMs) by incorporating external knowledge from linearized subgraphs retrieved from knowledge graphs. item.title: LLM4XCE: Large Language Models for Extremely Large-Scale Massive MIMO Channel Estimation
item.description: arXiv:2512.08955v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Extremely large-scale massive multiple-input multiple-output (XL-MIMO) is a key enabler for sixth-generation (6G) networks, offering massive spatial degrees of freedom. item.description: arXiv:2512.08957v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: User behavior prediction at scale remains a critical challenge for online B2C platforms. item.title: KAG - KAG is a logical form-guided reasoning and retrieval framework based on OpenSPG engine and LLMs. It is used to build logical reasoning and factual Q&A solutions for professional domain knowledge bases. It can effectively overcome the shortcomings of the traditional RAG vector similarity calculation model.
item.description: KAG is a logical form-guided reasoning and retrieval framework based on OpenSPG engine and LLMs. It is used to build logical reasoning and factual Q&A solutions for professional domain knowledge bases. It can effectively overcome the shortcomings of the traditional RAG vector similarity calculation model.<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> GitHub | <strong>Keywords:</strong> reasoning, model, framework, retrieval, RAG | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: DW-KNN: A Transparent Local Classifier Integrating Distance Consistency and Neighbor Reliability
item.description: arXiv:2512.08956v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: K-Nearest Neighbors (KNN) is one of the most used ML classifiers. However, if we observe closely, standard distance-weighted KNN and relative variants assume all 'k' neighbors are equally reliable.
